definition: meaningful and heartfelt words (idiom); sincere and earnest wishes

sentences.english: Canada is meanwhile getting older and its population is shifting westwards.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大面临人口老龄化，人口重心也在西移。

sentences.english: The unified construction of the cluster of sub-discipline must have a focus.
sentences.chinese: 这个子学科群的整体构建必有一个重心。

sentences.english: How do you live a life that puts a great emphasis on what matters?
sentences.chinese: 你怎样生活才能把生命的重心放在认为重要的东西上？

sentences.english: Moreover after Kyd has come, the attack center of gravity had already had the change.
sentences.chinese: 而且基德来了之后，进攻重心已经发生了改变。

sentences.english: Modernization of the Chinese traditional opera is a focus of Zhang Geng's life-long exploration of drama.
sentences.chinese: 戏曲现代化是张庚先生一生戏剧探索的重心。

sentences.english: Her weight is now on her front foot.
sentences.chinese: 她的重心现在在前脚上。

sentences.english: Center work means ballet exercises performed without support.
sentences.chinese: 重心训练是一种不靠支持物的芭蕾训练。

sentences.english: These sectors are already blossoming, albeit with a focus on domestic industry.
sentences.chinese: 这些行业多点开花，虽然重心仍在中国国内。

sentences.english: In the HND Department of BNU, the focus is on students.
sentences.chinese: 在北师大HND项目部，学生是一切工作的重心。

sentences.english: This mismatch in coefficient is certain to result in instability of the center of gravity.
sentences.chinese: 膨胀系数不相配必须会引起重心不稳定。

sentences.english: The development of the responsibility contract is central in this paper, so I will defer a more detailed discussion to a later section.
sentences.chinese: 承包合约是这篇文章的重心所在，我稍后才详论。

sentences.english: This geographical shift has brought dramatic changes in style and substance.
sentences.chinese: 区位的改变造成了风格和重心的巨变。

sentences.english: For a right-handed golfer, we transfer our weight forward to our left foot during the downswing.
sentences.chinese: 正如一名右手球员在下杆时会就将重心转移到左侧。

sentences.english: There was also more spin if the offset position was further from the centre of gravity.
sentences.chinese: 如果脚进一步偏离球体重心也将使球转得更快。

sentences.english: Or you might say this situation, mP because now we have the center of mass, mP, vertical line.
sentences.chinese: 也许你会说，由于存在重心，垂直线。

sentences.english: In a word. East River Region was the economic barycenter of Lingnan in Eastern Zhou Period.
sentences.chinese: 归纳之，东周时期东江流域是岭南的经济重心。

definition: to change direction/fig. to change one's stance
to get lost/to lose one's way
to incline/to lean/to slant/to slope/to tilt
(physics) inertia/(fig.) force of habit/tendency to do things in the accustomed way/habitual
to take advantage/to seize an opportunity/in passing/without taking extra trouble/conveniently
partial towards sth/to prefer/to incline/erroneous tendencies (Leftist or Revisionist deviation)
to stand/to have a footing/to be established/to base oneself on
to stress in a prejudiced way/to emphasize sth unduly
